p: KIR2DL2/2DL3 and its ligand HLA-C1 specifically control NK cell response. Its combination commonly exists in all the populations, but the frequencies were higher in the southern group (0.978 ± 0.006, 95% CI: 0.966–0.988) than in the northern group (0.860 ± 0.020, 95% CI: 0.833–0.886) ( p = 0.00005). KIR2DL1 and KIR2DS2 had a similar binding specificity for HLA-C2. The frequencies of 2DL1+HLA-C2 were lower in the southern group (0.211 ± 0.026, 95% CI: 0.162–0.264) than in the northern group (0.472 ± 0.021, 95% CI: 0.443–0.500) ( p = 0.003). However, there was no difference in frequencies of 2DS1+HLA-C2 combinations between the southern and northern groups ( Table 6).
